parameters.name: red
parameters.description: A number between and including 0 and 255

parameters.name: green
parameters.description: A number between and including 0 and 255

parameters.name: blue
parameters.description: A number between and including 0 and 255

parameters.name: alpha
parameters.description: A number between and including 0 and 255. Defaults to 255.

red.description: A number between and including 0 and 255

green.description: A number between and including 0 and 255

blue.description: A number between and including 0 and 255

alpha.description: A number between and including 0 and 255

toString.description: Returns a string representation of the color. Is either in `rgb(red, green, blue)` or `rgba(red, green, blue, alpha)` format. Note that alpha is a value between 0 and 1 in the string representation, but between 0 and 255 on the Color object.

toArray.description: Returns a array representation of the color in the format of `[red, green, blue, alpha]`. Each value is a number between (and in including) 0 and 255.

parameters.name: colorValue
parameters.description: The value to create a Color instance from

from.description: Creates a new instance of Color using any valid color expression. For any other value, including `null` and `'initial'` the method throws.

isColorValue.description: Returns true if value is a ColorValue. This includes `null` and `'initial'`. Use this to check if a value will be accepted by a color property. This is also a valid TypeScript type guard function.

isValidColorValue.description: Returns true if value is a valid ColorValue. This excludes `null` and `'initial'`. Use this to check if a value will be accepted by Color.from. This is also a valid TypeScript type guard function.
